basics.name: Sandeep Venkataram
basics.label: Computational Biologist
basics.summary: A computational biologist using genomics and data science to improve human health.

work.name: Hexagon Bio
work.summary: Developed custom bioinformatic solutions for building a phylogeny across 75k genomes and analyzing 1000+ chemical-genetic screens / week along with supporting laboratory R&D efforts

work.name: University of California, San Diego
work.summary: Developed an engineered microbial community suitable for quantifying the effect of species interactions on the repeatability of evolution. Discovered a novel evolutionary phenomenon, which we named 'evolutionary stalling'
highlights: 4 Peer-reviewed first-author publications, including publications in PNAS and Nature Ecology and Evolution

volunteer.organization: Society for Molecular Biology and Evolution
volunteer.summary: Drafter and submitted a symposium proposal for the SMBE 2018 meeting. Invited a keynote speaker, reviewed abstract submissions and selected oral and poster contributions to the symposium. I then chaired the symposium during the meeting.

As part of a 5-person steering committee, was involved in all aspects of putting on the conference including fundraising and organizing the venue, advertising, selecting speakers, organizing the program and managing the event.
I have consistently volunteered as a category judge at the Santa Clara and San Diego middle / high school science fairs.

awards.title: Best Contributed Oral Presentation
awards.summary: Awareded one of two awards for best oral presentation at the conference.'

awards.title: Finalst - Early Independence Award (DP5)
awards.summary: THe DP5 is a nationally competitive award for early academics. I was invited to present my work in front of the granting body at Washington DC.'

awards.title: Runner-up, Crow Award

- WGS variant calling pipelines identifying SNPs, InDels and structural variants from short-read sequencing data (Cell 2016).
